intro: Blepharis maderaspatensis, commonly known as the Madras grass or Indian grass, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
